name: ZAYTUNA COLLEGE
mission: Zaytuna College aims to educate and prepare morally committed professional, intellectual, and spiritual leaders, who are grounded in the Islamic scholar...
programs: BA in Liberal and Islamic Studies
Center for Ethical Living and Learning (ZCELL)
theoryOfChange: By training the mind through the trivium and quadrivium alongside Islamic primary texts, the college produces leaders who can navigate modern society with moral and spiritual grounding.

evaluationSources: Accredited by WASC Senior College and University Commission (WSCUC)

zakatClaimEvidence: Zaytuna College has a dedicated "Zakat Fund" which "serves as the basis of our financial aid program and is utilized to cover the total cost of educating a zakat-eligible student." Their donation page also lists "Zakat" as a designation option. Furthermore, Zaytuna College states, "Our current policy has been reviewed and approved by senior scholars, such as His Eminence, Shaykh Abdallah bin Bayyah, one of the foremost Muslim jurists of our time." (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFjZj9ls_cjqCGjOz6eZFuG61o14U90v849aIFKq70HibgYbOkoGffibqnMwxT3dACx93CKPa24x3a9jM9KOL-lyj1S_BLH_qG1d3w_b86pidZZRlpr8_6Xxu6IhR4d3IQD1T3U)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 29/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: ZAYTUNA COLLEGE shows good alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Zaytuna College has a dedicated "Zakat Fund" which "serves as the basis of our financial aid program and is utilized to cover the total cost of educating a zakat-eligible student." Their donation page also lists "Zakat" as a designation option. Furthermore, Zaytuna College states, "Our current policy has been reviewed and approved by senior scholars, such as His Eminence, Shaykh Abdallah bin Bayyah, one of the foremost Muslim jurists of our time." (Source: https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/grounding-api-redirect/AUZIYQFjZj9ls_cjqCGjOz6eZFuG61o14U90v849aIFKq70HibgYbOkoGffibqnMwxT3dACx93CKPa24x3a9jM9KOL-lyj1S_BLH_qG1d3w_b86pidZZRlpr8_6Xxu6IhR4d3IQD1T3U)

all_citations.claim: The organization reported a program expense ratio of 56.0%.
Total revenue for the period was $18,359,667 with a fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
The college offers a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts.
Zaytuna College is an accredited institution focused on Islamic scholarship.
Zaytuna College is zakat-eligible and accepts various forms of charitable giving.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The college maintains a moderate overall score of 54/100, reflecting strong financial stability and fundraising efficiency balanced against a lower program expense ratio and moderate impact directness.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 56.0% is lower than the industry benchmark for high-performing charities
Limited public data regarding specific long-term beneficiary outcomes

dimension_explanations.alignment: Zaytuna College shows medium donor alignment as it addresses the urgent need for global Islamic education and leadership [3]. Its status as a zakat-eligible institution provides a specific religious fit for Muslim donors, though its specialized academic focus may have a narrower appeal compared to humanitarian relief organizations [8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The college demonstrates a capacity-building impact model by educating intellectual and spiritual leaders [3]. While it maintains a total revenue of $18,359,667 and a significant working capital of 33.6 months, its program expense ratio is 56.0%, suggesting that a substantial portion of funds is directed toward administrative or capital needs rather than direct program delivery [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Zaytuna College serves as a premier liberal arts institution dedicated to grounding future leaders in the Islamic scholarly tradition.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised
Exceptional liquidity with 33.6 months of working capital available
Accredited academic programs focused on classical Islamic scholarship
baseline_narrative.summary: Zaytuna College is a non-profit educational institution that offers specialized degrees including a Bachelor of Arts in Liberal Arts and Islamic Studies and a Master of Arts in Islamic Texts [3][4]. The college operates as a zakat-eligible entity, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through educational support [8].
